title: Still Life
marks: Signature and Date LL in black: [Juan Gris/2-1917]
provenance:
(LÃ©once Rosenberg, Paris, France). [1] Dr. Gottlieb Friedrich Reber [c. 1880 - d. 1959], Lausanne, Switzerland, possibly by 1925. [2] Mr. and Mrs. Edward van Saher, New York, New York. (Fine Arts Associates, New York, New York); (M. Knoedler and Co., Inc., New York, New York by 1948); [3] Nelson Rockefeller, New York, New York in 1949. John Senior, Jr., New York, New York. (Buchholz Gallery (Curt Valentin), New York, New York); purchased by the MIA in 1951.

[1] Label on verso of painting: [Leonce Rosenberg / Galerie L'Effort Moderne / Leonce Rosenberg / Ãditeur d'Art / (25086) Rue de La Baume  no. 5127 / fevrier 1917].

[2] According to Daniel Henry Kahnweiler, "An Artful Life," p. 220, "Reber had to sell off a lot of his Cubist collection in 1929 following the crash of the stock market." Reber may have been buying for Paul Rosenberg and Co., and also purchased several works from the Heinemann Galerie, Munich, Germany.  

[3] The work was owned jointly by Fine Arts Associates and Knoedler's.
creditline: The John R. Van Derlip Fund
